＊ 符號表示重要常用功能: ＊ Indicates important and commonly used features.You may ignore the others.
pipe-t-1:
The nearest namespace will be used automatically.
This applies to the same service
lang-des:
Current active language as a signal.
Used for reactive bindings inside components that prefer signals over observables.
Always kept in sync with currentLang and onLangChange.
currentLang-des:
Current active language code.
Snapshot value of the language, useful in imperative code paths.
Equivalent to lang() but easier to use in plain TypeScript.
supportedLangs-des:
List of supported language codes resolved from the host configuration.
Used to validate requested languages and avoid loading unknown locales.
readySignal-des:
Namespace readiness flag as a signal.
Flips to true once the current namespace's translation resources are loaded for the active language (and build version).

Typical usage:
ready-des:
Convenience boolean wrapper around readySignal.
Returns true when the current namespace is fully loaded for the active language.
onLangChange-des:
Observable mirror of the language signal.
Provided for consumers that still rely on RxJS instead of signals.
onLangChange-emit-1: New language code every time setLang() is called successfully.
onLangChange-usage-1: Subscribe from non-signal-aware services or legacy code that needs to react to language changes.
setLang-des:
Switches the active language and triggers downstream refresh logic.
Also causes:
- lang signal to update
- currentLang to change
- onLangChange to emit.

The caller is responsible for passing a language contained in supportedLangs.
t-des:
Executes the 'translate' action.
 Resolves the translated string for the specified key within the service's current namespace.
If params are passed, the string is formatted with these parameters using ICU formatting, and the pre-configured fallback behavior is applied for missing keys
t-behavior-i-1: 1. If the namespace is not ready, returns an empty string and emits a debug warning when debug is enabled.
t-behavior-i-2: 2-0. If enablePageFallback is turned on, the translation resources configured for components set to page scope will be used as a fallback.
t-behavior-i-3: 2-1. If the key cannot be found in the current namespace, the system will attempt to find the translation in the configured fallback / global namespaces.
t-behavior-i-4: 3. If still missing, falls back according to missingTranslationBehavior ('show-key' | 'empty' | 'throw-error' | custom string).
addResourceBundle-des:
Pass-through helper to register a full resource bundle into the underlying core.
Useful for dynamically injecting translations at runtime (for example, from an API or feature module).
addResources-des:
Adds multiple translation entries into an existing bundle.
Intended for incremental extension of a namespace without replacing the entire bundle.
addResource-des:
Adds or overwrites a single translation entry in the core resource store.
Typically used for one-off overrides or test setups.
hasResourceBundle-des:
Checks whether a resource bundle is already loaded for a given language and namespace (and build version).
Useful to avoid duplicate loading or to implement custom preload logic.
getResource-des:
Retrieves a single raw translation entry from the core resource store.
Returns the unformatted value (for example, an ICU string), not the formatted result.
Primarily intended for advanced use cases or debugging.
getResourceBundle-des:
Retrieves the entire resource bundle object for a given language and namespace.
Allows low-level inspection or custom tooling around the loaded translations.
removeResourceBundle-des:
Removes a resource bundle from the core store.
Can be used to free memory or to force a reload of a namespace for a given language.
preloadNamespaces-des:
Preloads one or more namespaces ahead of time using the configured loader.
Useful for eagerly loading common namespaces before navigation and reducing the chance of seeing empty content on first render.
